name: Contact Poison
description: Poison that takes effect when touched with exposed skin, typically smeared on objects
trigger: Touching contact poison with exposed skin

application.duration: Remains potent until touched or washed off

samplePoisons.name: Crawler Mucus
samplePoisons.effect: Poisoned condition for 1 minute. Also Paralyzed while Poisoned. Repeats save at end of each turn, ending on success

samplePoisons.name: Oil of Taggit
samplePoisons.effect: Poisoned condition for 24 hours. Also Unconscious while Poisoned. Wakes if damaged

immediate: Additional conditions based on specific poison (Paralyzed, Unconscious)
ongoing: Effects persist for duration unless save repeated successfully
Some allow repeated saves at end of each turn
Some last fixed duration (minutes to hours)

detection.method: Wisdom (Perception) to notice substance on object, Intelligence (Investigation) or Intelligence (Nature) to identify poison

mitigation: Wear gloves or gauntlets when handling suspicious objects
Use mage hand or similar magic to manipulate objects from distance
Have servant or hireling handle objects first (unethical but effective)
Wash off poison before it can take effect (GM discretion on timing)
Have Resistance or Immunity to Poison damage
Use Protection from Poison spell (Advantage on saves)
Cast Detect Poison and Disease before handling objects
tacticalConsiderations: Excellent for trapping treasure or important items
Can be applied to commonly-touched surfaces
Ideal for incapacitating guards or targets without combat
Crawler Mucus paralysis makes targets helpless
Oil of Taggit provides long-term incapacitation
No attack roll needed - automatic if touched
Can affect multiple victims if applied to shared object

srdReference.quote: Contact poison can be smeared on an object and remains potent until it is touched or washed off. A creature that touches contact poison with exposed skin suffers its effects.

examples: Crawler Mucus on door handle of wizard's laboratory
Oil of Taggit on coins in treasure chest
Poisoned railing on balcony or staircase
Contact poison on weapon grip (affects anyone who picks it up)
Poisoned page edges in trapped spellbook
